author: Puidwen
title: more of a set then a minifig
review: Open the set, and got surprised when a bunch of bricks fell out, instead of mini-fig parts.  Compared to a regular lego set she came with a lot of extra parts  She has some bright nice colors, which are appropriately girly.  I will say that she a bit lacking in terms of posability, (only the head turns) but considering the character she's based on that can't be help.  She does have two problems.  One, you have to be sure the head is on good and tight or it fall off easily.  Two.  It's slurping hard to get the "leg bricks" to line up properly with the body.

author: Odeinoichus
title: Princess Unikitty Returns!
review:
Set #71023 Unikitty: This buildable character is the last from this Series of CMFs and she is familiar to many, using all the same parts as past iterations aside from the head print, Unikitty looks just like her old self. Either this represents a flashback moment or it's after she's calmed down from being Warrior Kitty.

It's a nice addition, but somewhat redundant if you collected all the sets from the first movie. Still, she's a very nice solid build and fun to have if you're new to the franchise and don't already own her. Recommended.

author: Lobo_da_boss_
title: A nice figure, but a bad CMF!
review:
Opening;

Unikitty is a very beloved and popular character from the two Lego Movie films, however 'Lego Movie 2 The Second Part' introduced the apocalypse unikitty, which was an interesting and rustic design, but in the own CMF series for the sequel it included a Unikitty that appears to have been taken out of a 2014 'Lego Movie' set.

The figure -

The figure has a light blue horn attached to a hollow white stud, two dark pink 1×1 cheese slopes for ears on a 1×3 pink plate, a generic printed unikitty face on a 1×3 pink brick with a 1×3 white plate underneath, a hollow spring green stud is the attached for a very unstable neck, an unprinted 1×3 pink arch brick for the body and a printed white tail and the feet are a sand yellow and light blue 1×1 plate attached to 1×1 white plates for her rainbow design.

The stand -

The stand is just the standard white 'Lego Movie two The Second Part' CMF stand.

In conclusion -

This is a good figure for someone who doesn't own a normal Unikitty however whilst it is subjectively a good figure, it is objectively a bad CMF, it just isn't interesting enough to warrant that kind of exposure. Also, the neck/head attachment is so weak it falls off with the slightest touch, I really don't understand this as Lego have a much sturdier design for this but oh well, with that in mind I can only recommend this to a select group, but most people have this seen as though it came out 2 years and 8 months ago (at the time of writing this review).
